title.narrative: LEGISLATION, POLICIES AND STRATEGIC PLAN

description.narrative: Equity-focused legislation, policies and strategic plans related to pregnant women, newborns and young children health, HIV prevention and control, nutrition and sanitation are developed, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health Systems Strengthening, Hiv â€“ General, Micronutrients, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Sanitation, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, newborns and young children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from quality neonatal, child health, HIV, nutrition and sanitation services, including in emergency situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Equity-focused legislation, policies and strategic plans related to pregnant women, newborns and young children health, HIVprevention and control, nutrition and sanitation are developed

description.narrative: UNICEF supported Government to develop and update policies, strategies and guidelines to ensure, in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, enabling environment to achieve SDG 3 (healthy lives and well-being for all). Support was provided for completion of the Epidemiological Situation of HIV transmission, measuring country&39;s progress towards the elimination of vertical transmission. The updating of national breastfeeding policy, based on the Code marketing of Breastmilk substitutes, facilitated progress for implementation of Baby Friendly Hospital Initiative (BFHI). Regarding sanitation UNICEF collaborated in the National Strategy of Environmental Sanitation and based on 2020 Plastics Management Law, facilitated awareness-raising interventions among students | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
